alert.note: Alert for Bond; Clinton; Fayette; Marion; Randolph; Washington (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 15 at 2:07PM CDT until May 18 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM CDT THIS EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Portions of Illinois, including the following areas, Bond IL, Clinton IL, Fayette IL, Madison IL, Marion IL, Monroe IL, Randolph IL, Saint Clair IL and Washington IL. Portions of east central Missouri, including the following areas, Franklin MO, Jefferson MO, Saint Louis City MO and Saint Louis MO. * WHEN...From 9 PM CDT this evening through Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Recent heavy rains have fallen over these areas. An additional 2 to 3 inches is expected to fall through Tuesday morning.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Bond; Clinton; Fayette; Marion; Randolph; Washington
